H0.text: Living organisms are the reason why a rosebush and a bird are similar, because both are living organisms.

H1.text: Need to search for food is what makes a rosebush and a bird similar.

H2.text: Make their own food is what a rosebush and a bird do, making them similar.

H3.text: Non‑living organisms are what a rosebush and a bird are similar because they both are non‑living organisms.

A4.text: A rose is a woody perennial flowering plant of the genus Rosa, in the family Rosaceae.

A6.text: Birds are a group of warm-blooded theropod dinosaurs constituting the class Aves, characterised by feathers, toothless beaked jaws, the laying of hard-shelled eggs, a high metabolic rate, a four-chambered heart, and a strong yet lightweight skeleton.

A7.text: Birds live worldwide and range in size from the 5.5 cm (2.2 in) bee hummingbird to the 2.8 m (9 ft 2 in) common ostrich.
